_header: I shall you tell a full good sport
Note: For a version in quatrains cf. 3795.
_description: The Gossips’ Meeting — twenty-five 6-line stanzas (aaabbc) with ‘Good gossips myn’ refrain and burden: ‘Hoow gossip myne gossip myn / Whan will we go to the wyne / Good gossipes [myn]’

BodEngPoete1.First Lines:
I wyll yow tell afull good sportHow gossyps gather them on a
                    sort…
BodEngPoete1.Note: Probably the same as the Ipswich ‘Fitch’ MS.

OxfBal354.First Lines:
I shall you tell a full good sportHow gossippis gader them on a
                    sort…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…Will not be RefusedGood gossippis myn
                    aExplicit
